items.sentence: My mother is two years younger than my father.
I\'ve learned to speak French a little better.
I\'ve made a list of people I need to talk to.
I\'ve made up my mind to ask Mary to marry me.
We have a few more hours before Tom gets here.
We have far better things to do with our time.
We have no choice but to eat this moldy bread.
We have to figure out where Tom hid his money.
Tom had Mary translate the letter into French.
Tom had no idea that Mary was already married.
Tom had only himself to blame for the failure.
Tom has a friend whose father is an astronaut.
Do you think you can do that without any help?
Do you think you could give Tom a little help?
Do you think you could talk to Tom about that?
Do you think you speak French better than Tom?
It\'s really dark here. I can\'t see anything.
Is it possible to forget your native language?
Is it possible to land a plane on this island?
Is it true Tom will go to Australia next year?
Is it true you learned French all by yourself?
Tom eats everything that his mother gives him.
Tom eats lunch near the office where he works.
Tom enjoys a glass of wine every now and then.
Tom expects to finish the report by next week.
You said you and Tom weren\'t exactly friends.
You won\'t believe how popular Tom has become.
I didn\'t know Tom was going to go to Harvard.
I didn\'t know that I was supposed to do that.
I didn\'t know when to switch the machine off.
I didn\'t know you were staying at this hotel.
I don\'t feel like taking a walk this morning.
I don\'t know your reasons for not liking Tom.
Do you and Tom often hang out with each other?
Do you consider yourself to be a lucky person?
Do you have a license to operate a motor boat?
I thought I heard someone banging on the wall.
I don\'t think I would enjoy doing that again.
I don\'t think Tom has time to help you today.
I don\'t think Tom is as good-looking as John.
Tom will be eligible for parole in five years.
Tom wrote something on the back of the letter.
You\'ll soon get used to eating Japanese food.
You\'re not going to call my parents, are you?
I suspect Tom won\'t want to do that tomorrow.
I\'ve heard nothing but good things about Tom.
I\'ve never felt this way about anyone before.
I\'m dying to know what\'s in Tom\'s suitcase.
Tom wanted to prove to himself he could do it.
Tom wants Mary to know that she can trust him.
